channel.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
channel.description:
The Integer data type can go as high as 2,147,483,647. The Long data type can go as high as 9,223,372,036,854,775,807.
So I assume they changed players stats to the Long data type because people all ready have over 2.1b experience Why not GP though?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“lawl_temp, post:18, topic:425158”]why dont they just get another cup?[/quote]2girls2cups?

Read full topic

item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Well beyond the memory, bandwidth, and storage implications of an extra four bytes…I think they simply won’t update it for historical reasons and for the infeasibility of being able to have that much money. Mathematically, one person could store 0xffffffff (around 4 billion) times more gold than before, with those extra 4 bytes. This could be devastating on the RS economy if anyone actually tried gathering even one millionth of that limit on one account (which comes out to about 9.223 trillion gold).

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I thought it was to conserve bandwidth? I was too young at the time, but when the game first came out, wasn’t unlimited bandwidth unheard of? Why send an extra 4 bytes per item when no one would even come close to having the maximum amount for a while

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @n3ss3s n3ss3s
item.description:
@n3ss3s wrote:

Jagex should add higher valued coins that can be converted to and from instantly, instead of waiting for players to come up with workarounds such as shards…

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Taharok:

You can sell them in large batches to the pet shop owner in Tavelry. No money lost.

I once sold 50k or so spirit shards to the shop via right clicking because I didn’t know about the pet shop owner

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“kyocera, post:12, topic:425158”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=527822.msg3849061#msg3849061 date=1323873025]

Whenever this question is asked, the answer is the same. It uses more memory, which may be a problem on older or lower-powered machines with less memory, and it can make it slightly slower. It’s really just a design decision, and if they don’t see it as being a problem, then they won’t change it.

Some people all ready got max cash, instead of getting more cash they have to invest in items. :S

I think that the percentage of the people that run into that issue is so small that, in jagex’s mind, it does not outweigh the costs of changing the system.
[/quote]That percentage isn’t very small anymore.

that’s why I was asking lol, it’s getting smaller and smaller everyday. For some reason dueling was not that big of a deal 4 years ago, but now in like days it made people with 50m to50b!

You can use shards now as a token of GP.

not really, they take too long to sell, and you’ll probably lose 1gp per shard so that’s a 3m loss per 2.146gp spent.[/quote]

You can sell them in large batches to the pet shop owner in Tavelry. No money lost.

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @kyocera kyocera
item.description:
@kyocera wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:10, topic:425158”][quote author=cooper link=topic=527822.msg3849048#msg3849048 date=1323871280]

Whenever this question is asked, the answer is the same. It uses more memory, which may be a problem on older or lower-powered machines with less memory, and it can make it slightly slower. It’s really just a design decision, and if they don’t see it as being a problem, then they won’t change it.

Some people all ready got max cash, instead of getting more cash they have to invest in items. :S

I think that the percentage of the people that run into that issue is so small that, in jagex’s mind, it does not outweigh the costs of changing the system.
[/quote]That percentage isn’t very small anymore.[/quote]
that’s why I was asking lol, it’s getting smaller and smaller everyday. For some reason dueling was not that big of a deal 4 years ago, but now in like days it made people with 50m to50b!

[qoute]You can use shards now as a token of GP.[/quote]

not really, they take too long to sell, and you’ll probably lose 1gp per shard so that’s a 3m loss per 2.146gp spent.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @kyocera kyocera
item.description:
@kyocera wrote:

[quote=“Ollie, post:2, topic:425158”]using a long would use up more cache, meaning you have fewer elements in large arrays that are in the cache at that moment in time, meaning overall less performance.

im not sure if that is the reason they won’t be using it but they will have a valid reason.[/quote]

ooohh okay, they I guess, people with 9 sextilion GP might lag a bit…

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

item.title: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

using a long would use up more cache, meaning you have fewer elements in large arrays that are in the cache at that moment in time, meaning overall less performance.

im not sure if that is the reason they won’t be using it but they will have a valid reason.

Read full topic
item.source: Why doesn't Jagex just use a Long data type for items?

Why not GP though?
